thread.section_title: eTurboNews (eTN) - Original and unique global international news with a focus on travel and tourism
thread.title: Pegasus reaches 100 destinations

author: eTN Global Editor
title: Pegasus reaches 100 destinations
text:
Oct 13, 2015 eTN   
LONDON, England - Pegasus Airlines has reached a milestone of 100 destinations as it launches its latest two new routes, Turkey’s Kars and Ordu-Giresun. Flights between Istanbul’s Sabiha Gokcen Airport and Kars Airport are launching on 9 November, while the Ordu-Giresun route launches on 13 November, with daily return flights scheduled for both destinations. 
Pegasus flies daily to Kars and Ordu-Giresun 
Flights to Kars from London Stansted via Istanbul’s Sabiha Gokcen will depart daily at 00:15, returning from Kars at 09:50, connecting Kars to a total of 38 destinations including 30 international destinations: Almaty, Amsterdam, Athens, Bahrain, Barcelona, Basel, Bishkek, Bucharest, Geneva, Doha, Dubai, Düsseldorf, Frankfurt, Kharkiv, North Cyprus – Ercan, Kuwait, London – Stansted, Lviv, Milan (Malpensa), Munich, Oslo, Paris, Pristina, Roma, Sarajevo, Skopje, Stuttgart, Tel Aviv, Tiran and Vienna – and eight domestic destinations in Turkey: Ankara, Antalya, Bodrum, Dalaman, Denizli, Izmir, Samsun and Trabzon. 
Flights between Ordu-Giresun and London Stansted via Istanbul’s Sabiha Gokcen will operate 9x weekly departing at 00.15 from London Stansted and returning from Ordu-Giresun at 09.00, and flights between London Gatwick and Ordu-Giresun departing at 11.45 from London Gatwick and returning from Ordu-Giresun at 21.45. The new route connects Ordu-Giresun to a total of 50 destinations via Istanbul: 28 international destinations: Almaty, Amsterdam, Athens, Baghdad, Barcelona, Basel, Bishkek, Bologna, Bucharest, Geneva, Düsseldorf, Erbil, Frankfurt, London Gatwick and Stansted, Hurghada, Kharkiv, North Cyprus – Ercan, Kutaisi, Lviv, Milan (Malpensa), Mineralnye Vody, Moscow, Munich, Nuremberg, Paris, Prague, Pristina, Rome, Sarajevo, Skopje, Stuttgart, Sharm El Sheikh, Tehran, Tel Aviv, Tbilisi, Tirana and Vienna – and 12 domestic destinations Adana, Ankara, Antalya, Bodrum, Dalaman, Denizli, Elazığ, Gaziantep, Hatay, Izmir, Kayseri and Konya.
